snippet: A member of the State Duma, the lower house of Parliament, has proposed legislation allowing the authorities to take custody of children if one or both of their parents are gay.
abstract: Member of Russia's lower house of Parliament proposes bill that would allow authorities to take custody of children if one or both of their parents are gay; supporters of law say it is intended to protect children, while critics argue it is transparent effort to suppress homosexuality.
lead_paragraph: A member of the State Duma, the lower house of Parliament, has proposed legislation allowing the authorities to take custody of children if one or both of their parents are gay.

headline.main: Russia: Bill Would Allow Children to Be Taken Away From Gay Parents
headline.print_headline: Russia: Legislation Would Allow Children To Be Taken Away From Gay Parents
